details:
libtiff is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows and integer overflows
that can lead to application crashes (denial of service) or worse.


* [CVE-2016-10266](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10266)
Integer overflow that can lead to divide-by-zero in
 TIFFReadEncodedStrip (tif\_read.c).
* [CVE-2016-10267](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10267)
Divide-by-zero error in OJPEGDecodeRaw (tif\_ojpeg.c).
 
[CVE-2016-10268](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10268)


Heap-based buffer overflow in TIFFReverseBits (tif\_swab.c).
* [CVE-2016-10269](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10269)
Heap-based buffer overflow in \_TIFFmemcpy (tif\_unix.c).


For Debian 7 Wheezy, these problems have been fixed in version
4.0.2-6+deb7u11.


We recommend that you upgrade your tiff packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
